#Text='
#Text=Conference of the Americas ' announced for 2008
#Text=File : COTA Logo .
#Text=jpg
#Text=Conference of The Americas logo .
#Text=Image : Mike Halterman .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=Monday , October 15 , 2007

#Text=Atlanta , Georgia — After losing their bid to host Wikimania 2008 , Wikimedians from the Atlanta , Georgia bid proposal are now working to host a conference focusing on Wikimedia in the Americas .

#Text=Mike Halterman , a student at the University of South Florida and unpaid intern at the Wikimedia Foundation ( WMF ) offices in St. Petersburg , Florida , is helping to plan the Conference of the Americas which will be held at the Georgia Institute of Technology ( Georgia Tech ) in Atlanta , Georgia on May 15-18 , 2008 .

#Text=Several others who helped in the conference 's creation include : Andrew Guyton , Dan Rosenthal , Geoff Swanstrom , Hillary Lipko , Jessica Gibson , Matt Britt , and Wikinews administrator and contributor Craig Spurrier .
#Text=" We went forward after Wikimania because we felt that we had a good idea on our hands , and all the organization and manpower should not go to waste .

#Text=We want to show the work done by people here , and how it impacts people here ,  said Halterman in an exclusive interview with Wikinews .

#Text=The conference is focused on  discussions of Wikimedia and the free culture movement and how they relate to communities ( national/regional , social , linguistic ) ; discussions about the impacts free culture movements have in these communities , and by the work done in said movements in everyday life , " says the announcement .

column1: #Text=The discussion includes North America , specifically the United States and Canada , along with the countries of Latin America .
#Text=Wikimedia Argentina and the WMF have also been given a proposal , but decisions on endorsement are still pending for both .
#Text=There will also be a journalism segment that will be held inside the Turner Broadcasting building on Techwood Drive in Midtown Atlanta .

#Text=After the location of Wikimania 2008 was announced to be in Alexandria , Egypt , the LGBT community spoke out , wondering if the jury , a group of Wikimedians who selected the location , took into account LGBT rights , safety of all attending , human rights , or free speech in the country before making their decision .
#Text=There has since been discussion and controversy over the location posted on several public mailing lists .

#Text=Despite that , Halterman , who was on the bidding team to have Wikimania 2008 in Atlanta , states that the Conference of the Americas was not formed in retaliation , revenge or to " out maneuver " Wikimania 2008 and that the discussion for the COTA was taking place long before the location of Wikimania was announced .
#Text=He also states that the conference 's purpose is not to compete with it , but to give those who are in the western hemisphere a chance to attend a Wikimedia event for the Americas .
#Text=" This was never something that was supposed to be ' the American solution .

#Text=Reaching out to the other communities is high on our list of priorities and we really do want to make this a hemispheric effort  as " it 's more expensive for people to go to Egypt over something in their own country or something close enough to it , " said Halterman to Wikinews .
